Dear Ana Claire McClain:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During school, a youth snuck into the bathroom where another
youth was, and they engaged in sexual intercourse. Supervision
is a concern.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed via phone on October 10,
2024. Administrator reported initially Youth B reported Youth A
had only kissed her on September 5, 2024. She reported Youth B
is now reporting she had sexual intercourse with Youth A during
the incident on September 5, 2024. She reported when the initial
incident was disclosed an internal investigation occurred and it
was found Youth A did leave sight of staff and admitted to kissing
Youth B when he met her in the restroom near the school when
out of sight of staff for five minutes. The staff involved received
disciplinary action due to a lack of communication among the
team members. Administrator reported since that incident, Youth
A and Youth B are on sexual safety plans.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 14, 2024. Youth A reported he formed a plan with Youth
B to meet in the restroom when they were watching a movie in the
classroom. He reported he was able to whisper to her without the
staff hearing. Youth A reported Youth B asked Staff 1 to use the
restroom and then he asked for a 60-second break. He reported
no one was supervising him in the hallway so he met Youth B in
the restroom. Youth A did not want to discuss what happened in
the restroom but stated that it was consensual for what occurred.
He reported typically staff supervise well but knew he could get
away with it with Staff 1 not supervising. Youth A reported he did
not know about the rules about youth not being allowed in the
hallway when another youth is in the restroom without a staff
supervising.
2

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 14, 2024. Youth B reported she had been talking with
Youth A in the classroom when they were watching movies. She
reported she started to have feelings for Youth A, and they started
to date. Youth B reported on September 5, 2024, Youth A cleared
his throat in the classroom to give her the signal to meet him in the
hallway. She reported she asked Staff 1 to use the restroom and
Youth A was going to ask to take a 60-second break. Youth B
reported Youth A met her in the restroom where they were able to
kiss and have sex. She reported at one point in the restroom
Youth A checked to see if anyone was checking for him and told
her that no one was in the hallway. Youth B reported they were in
the restroom for about six to seven minutes and staff never
checked in on them. She reported the sexual acts that occurred
were consensual. Youth B reported when she walked back into
the classroom a few minutes later she was asked by staff what
happened, and she could not remember who the staff was that
asked. She reported she got scared and reported she just kissed
Youth A in the restroom. Youth B reported after a few weeks went
by she told staff that they had sex because she did not want to
hide the secret anymore. She reported she was unaware of any
rules about staff having to supervise the youth in the hallway or
that a youth cannot be in the hallway when a youth is in the
restroom without staff supervising.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on October 15, 2024. Staff 1
reported she has worked at the facility for four years and primarily
worked in the on-site classroom. She reported on September 5,
2024, Staff 2 left the classroom to use the restroom leaving her
with Staff 3 and the teacher with the youth. Staff 1 reported that
normally it is not an issue but when Staff 2 left, Youth B asked to
use the restroom, so she brought her to the restroom and returned
to supervise the classroom. Then Youth A asked to take a 60-
second break out in the hallways, which she allowed him to do.
Staff 1 reported that normally the staff is required to stand out in
the hallway when there is a youth in the restroom and a youth
taking a 60-second break in the hallway but because Staff 2 was
in the restroom she maintained supervision of the classroom
instead. She reported after a few minutes she went to check on
Youth A in the hallway but could not find him. Staff 1 reported after
a few moments, Youth A walked back into the classroom, and she
asked him where he was. She reported Youth A tried to lie saying
that he was with another staff but when Staff 1 stated that she was
going to confirm with that staff, Youth A then disclosed going into
the restroom with Youth B. Staff 1 reported she knew she should
have been standing in the hallway but could not do that because
3

Staff 2 was in the restroom for about ten minutes and she needed
to keep eyes on the classroom with Staff 3.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
14, 2024. Staff 2 reported he works primarily in the classroom
area with the youth. He reported that the main job of staff in the
classroom is to supervise and support the youth. Staff 2 reported
there should never be two youth out in the hallway area without a
staff supervising. He reported he is aware of the incident that
occurred on September 5, 2024, but was not present because he
was using the restroom. Staff 2 reported he told Staff 1 he was
going to use the restroom and there was coverage of Staff 1, Staff
3, and the teacher to meet the needs of the youth. He reported
youth are allowed to take a 60-second break in the hallway, but
staff are still responsible for maintaining supervision. Staff 2
reported Youth A should have not been taking a break alone,
especially when Youth B was in the restroom.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on October 15, 2024. Staff 3
reported she primarily works as direct care staff on the units but
was helping with coverage in the classroom on September 5,
2024. She reported she supervised and supported the youth in the
classroom while Staff 1 walked Youth B to the restroom and was
in charge of monitoring Youth A. Staff 3 reported she was
unaware of the requirements for supervision when a youth is in a
hallway and another youth is using the restroom. She reported in
her mind best practice would be to monitor the hallway to make
sure a youth did not go into the restroom with another youth.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 09/05/2024 in the hallway area outside the East
Campus classroom was reviewed on 10/14/2024. Staff 1 walked
Youth B down to the restroom at 02:08 and Staff 1 walked back to
the classroom at 02:09. Youth A walked out into the hallway at
02:09 and Staff 1 walked past him. Staff 1 went back into the
classroom while Youth A was in the hallway. Youth A walked past
the classroom door and knocked on the restroom door. The
restroom door opened and Youth A walked into the restroom that
Youth B was in. The restroom door cracked open and then closed
again. At 02:12, Staff 1 walked out of the classroom and looked
around in the hallway. Staff 1 walked back into the classroom. At
02:13, Youth A walked out of the restroom, stood in the hallway,
then back into the classroom. Then Youth B walked out of the
same restroom when Youth A was walking into the classroom.
Documents Reviewed:
4

-Facility Incident report dated September 5, 2024- Staff 1
completed this incident report. The incident report notes Youth B
asked Staff 1 to go to the restroom. Then a few minutes later,
Youth A requested a 60-second break from the classroom, which
Staff 1 granted. Youth A stood outside the classroom door while
Staff 1 monitored the classroom computers and Staff 3 was
watching the youth in the classroom. After about two to three
minutes, Staff 1 noticed Youth B was no longer standing outside
the classroom and believed Youth A went with another staff. After
a few minutes later Youth A came back into the classroom and a
few seconds after Youth A’s return, Youth B returned. Staff 1
spoke with Youth B who reported Youth A had knocked and
followed her into the restroom and kissed her. Youth A confirmed
he did kiss Youth B in the restroom and apologized for his actions.
-Facility Residential Staffing Ratios Procedures dated July 3,
2024- This procedure notes that direct care staff members are
required to maintain supervision of youths at all times except
when youth are in their individual sleeping rooms or restrooms.
- Facility Guidelines for the Education Specialist- This form is
to be used by facility that staff that support youth within the
educational classrooms at the facility. The guideline notes that if a
youth is taking a break in the hall, staff are to stand in the doorway
so they can monitor the youth and the classroom.
-Sexual Safety Plan for Youth A dated September 6, 2024- Due
to the incident that occurred on September 5, 2024, Youth A has
been put on increased supervision with staff. It notes Youth A is to
not be out of staff sight if he is taking 60 in the hallway and staff
will wait in the hallway when he is using the school restroom. Staff
will redirect and process all boundary violations with Youth A.
- Sexual Safety Plan for Youth B dated September 6, 2024-
Due to the incident that occurred on September 5, 2024, Youth B
has been put on increased supervision with staff. If Youth B is
involved in an activity with Youth A, Staff are to provide 1:1
staffing to ensure appropriate boundaries are occurring. Staff will
redirect and process all boundary violations with Youth B.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 was terminated from
employment at the facility on September 13, 2024 due to not
providing adequate supervision to Youth A on September 5, 2024
and put in minimal effort searching for Youth A when she noticed
he was not in the hallway. The facility found Staff 1 to not be
incompliance with their Staffing Ratio Procedure which resulted in
5

her termination. On October 13, 2020, Staff 1 signed a facility
document understanding Staff Expectations for supervising clients
at all times. Staff 1 was in compliance with all required trainings
and completed Supervision training on October 19, 2022.
- Staff 2’s Human Resource File- Staff 2 has received
disciplinary actions for speeding in an agency vehicle, failure to
complete some training timely and attendance issues. On
September 11, 2024, Staff 2 received a written warning not
securing coverage while working in the youth classroom when he
had to use the restroom. Staff 2 was in compliance with all
required trainings and completed Supervision training on
September 3, 2024.
- Staff 3’s Human Resource File- Staff 3 has not received any
disciplinary actions. Staff 3 was in compliance with all required
trainings and completed Supervision training on June 4, 2024.
Analysis The facility is found in in violation as Staff 2 did not follow the
classroom supervision guideline as it was found she did not stand
in the hallway when Youth A was taking a break. Video footage
showed Staff 2 did not maintain supervision in the hallway and
Staff 2 admitted she should have been standing in the hallway to
supervise Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
